intro: Hieracium odontotrichum, commonly known as the toothed hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in grassy areas and open woodlands. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are characterized by their serrated edges. It has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and is often found in disturbed soils. Hieracium odontotrichum is a perennial species that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
